title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.3 - Application procedure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.3 - Application procedure

State Regulations
(a) A provider agency seeking funding
pursuant to this Part shall prepare an application on the form prescribed by
the commissioner of the Division of Criminal Justice Services. An original and
four copies shall be submitted to the contracts unit of the Division of

Criminal Justice Services. All applications must have the signed approval of
the county executive or his equivalent and be submitted through the criminal
justice planner of the county or region. If the county does not have such a
planner, it must be submitted through the county executive or an equivalent
office. District attorneys may submit applications directly to the Division of

Criminal Justice Services upon notification thereof to their respective county
executives or criminal justice planners. Only those applications which are
totally completed will be considered for funding. (b) Preference. Preference will be given to
victim service agencies that provide those services, including but not limited
to temporary relocation, changes in employment, transportation to and from
court, moving assistance, temporary lodging and support services necessary for
the prevention of intimidation and protection of eligible witnesses. (c) Nonsupplantation. Funds provided to
successful applicants under this program shall be used to augment, not to
supplant, applicant's current funding for victim assistance or witness
protection services. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6171.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
